description: GENERATED FROM DATABASE - DO NOT EDIT

parameters.name: Abstract Vs Concrete
parameters.definition: Visual learners prefer concrete over abstract

parameters.name: Adapt to Feedback Style
parameters.definition: Adjust feedback detail based on learner preference

parameters.name: Adapt to Interaction Style
parameters.definition: Adjust questioning and engagement based on interaction preference

parameters.name: Adapt to Learning Style
parameters.definition: Adjust behavior targets based on visual/auditory/reading learning style

parameters.name: Adapt to Pace Preference
parameters.definition: Adjust pacing and depth based on learner's preferred speed

parameters.name: Adapt to Question Frequency
parameters.definition: Adjust responsiveness based on how often learner asks questions

parameters.name: Aggregate Learner Profile
parameters.definition: Combines recent observations into stable profile attributes

parameters.name: Agreeableness Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Warmth and directness based on caller's agreeableness: high = warm cooperative, low = direct honest
parameters.interpretationHigh: Warm Cooperative: Friendly, harmony-focused, relationship-building
parameters.interpretationLow: Direct Honest: Straightforward, efficient, no-nonsense

parameters.name: Analogy Usage
parameters.definition: Visual learners respond well to analogies

parameters.name: Practice vs Explanation Target
parameters.definition: Activity balance based on application ability: high = more practice, low = more explanation
parameters.interpretationHigh: Strong Application: Ready for complex practice
parameters.interpretationLow: Weak Application: More explanation before practice

parameters.name: Application Score
parameters.definition: Measures learner's ability to apply concepts to new situations
parameters.interpretationHigh: Expert Application: Applies fluently to novel situations
parameters.interpretationLow: No Application: Cannot apply concept

parameters.name: Auditory Modality Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Teaching style targets based on auditory modality strength
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Auditory: Use rich verbal elaboration, encourage talk-through, attend to rhythm
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Auditory: Keep verbal explanations concise; consider written or visual alternatives

parameters.name: agreeableness
parameters.definition: Agreeableness - cooperation, trust, empathy, tendency to be helpful and avoid conflict
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Agreeable: Very accommodating; may not voice concerns; needs explicit invitation to disagree
parameters.interpretationLow: Challenging/Skeptical: Will question and push back; needs to be convinced; values their own judgment

parameters.name: conscientiousness
parameters.definition: Conscientiousness - organization, dependability, self-discipline, preference for planned behavior
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Conscientious: Needs detailed plans, precise information, clear expectations
parameters.interpretationLow: Flexible/Spontaneous: Prefers flexibility, may resist rigid processes, comfortable with ambiguity

parameters.name: extraversion
parameters.definition: Extraversion - energy, positive emotions, assertiveness, sociability, talkativeness
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Extraverted: Energized by interaction; wants rapport and engagement
parameters.interpretationLow: Introverted: Prefers focused, task-oriented interaction; may find chattiness draining

parameters.name: neuroticism
parameters.definition: Neuroticism - tendency to experience negative emotions, emotional reactivity, anxiety
parameters.interpretationHigh: Anxious: Needs significant reassurance; sensitive to uncertainty; provide extra support
parameters.interpretationLow: Emotionally Stable: Calm under pressure; doesn't need much reassurance; handles stress well

parameters.name: openness
parameters.definition: Openness to Experience - intellectual curiosity, creativity, preference for novelty and variety
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Open: Seeks novelty, abstract thinker, creative problem-solver
parameters.interpretationLow: Traditional/Practical: Prefers familiar approaches, concrete information, proven methods

parameters.name: BEH ABSTRACT OK
parameters.definition: Comfortable with theoretical concepts

parameters.name: BEH ACTION VERBS
parameters.definition: Ground in action rather than abstraction

parameters.name: BEH ADVANCE READINESS
parameters.definition: Ready to move to next module

parameters.name: BEH ANALOGY USAGE
parameters.definition: Analogies can unlock understanding

parameters.name: BEH APPROACH SWITCHING
parameters.definition: Switch between modalities freely

parameters.name: BEH CHALLENGE LEVEL
parameters.definition: Ready for harder problems

parameters.name: BEH CHECK FOR UNDERSTANDING
parameters.definition: Frequently verify comprehension

parameters.name: BEH CONCEPT DENSITY
parameters.definition: Can handle more concepts at once

parameters.name: Conversational Depth
parameters.definition: How deeply the companion explores topics with the person
parameters.interpretationHigh: Deep: Going deep into topics, nuanced exploration
parameters.interpretationLow: Surface: Keeping conversation light and superficial

parameters.name: BEH CONVERSATIONAL TONE
parameters.definition: Keep it casual and natural

parameters.name: BEH DEFINITION PRECISION
parameters.definition: R/W learner values precise definitions

parameters.name: BEH DIAGRAM LANGUAGE
parameters.definition: Describe concepts as visual structures

parameters.name: BEH DIRECTNESS
parameters.definition: Set directness high - no-nonsense communication

parameters.name: Empathy Rate
parameters.definition: How empathetically the companion responds to shared experiences
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Empathy: Responding empathetically, acknowledging feelings
parameters.interpretationLow: Transactional: Responding without emotional acknowledgment

parameters.name: BEH EXAMPLE RICHNESS
parameters.definition: More concrete examples needed

parameters.name: BEH EXPLANATION VARIETY
parameters.definition: Try different explanation approaches

parameters.name: BEH FEELING LANGUAGE
parameters.definition: Use feel/sense/touch language

parameters.name: BEH FORMALITY
parameters.definition: Set formality higher - structured, organized

parameters.name: BEH FOUNDATION FOCUS
parameters.definition: Must fill foundational gaps

parameters.name: BEH GUIDED PRACTICE
parameters.definition: Practice needs heavy guidance

parameters.name: BEH IMAGERY DENSITY
parameters.definition: Visual learner benefits from rich mental imagery

parameters.name: Insight Frequency
parameters.definition: How often the agent shares interesting knowledge, facts, anecdotes, or connections during a call
parameters.interpretationHigh: Knowledge-Rich: 3+ insights per call. Actively look for opportunities to share interesting connections.
parameters.interpretationLow: Listener: Pure listening mode. Share knowledge only if directly asked.

parameters.name: Intellectual Challenge
parameters.definition: How much intellectual challenge the companion provides
parameters.interpretationHigh: Challenging: Providing genuine intellectual challenge
parameters.interpretationLow: Comfortable: Keeping things easy and comfortable

parameters.name: BEH INTERLEAVING
parameters.definition: Mix review with current topic

parameters.name: BEH LIST STRUCTURE
parameters.definition: Organize as numbered lists and hierarchies

parameters.name: Memory Reference
parameters.definition: How often and appropriately the companion references previous conversations and known facts
parameters.interpretationHigh: Good Continuity: Appropriately referencing family names, interests, past conversations
parameters.interpretationLow: No References: Not referencing past conversations or known facts

parameters.name: BEH MODALITY CONSISTENCY
parameters.definition: Stick with what works

parameters.name: BEH MODALITY VARIETY
parameters.definition: Use all channels based on content

parameters.name: BEH NEW CONTENT RATE
parameters.definition: Limit new content until review complete

parameters.name: BEH NUANCE EXPLORATION
parameters.definition: Explore edge cases and nuances

parameters.name: Pace Matching
parameters.definition: How well the companion adapts to the person's energy and rhythm
parameters.interpretationHigh: Well Matched: Adapting well to person's energy and rhythm
parameters.interpretationLow: Mismatched: Not matching the person's pace

parameters.name: Patience Level
parameters.definition: How patient and unhurried the companion is
parameters.interpretationHigh: Patient: Unhurried, allowing time for thought, not rushing
parameters.interpretationLow: Rushed: Moving too fast, not allowing time

parameters.name: BEH PAUSE TOLERANCE
parameters.definition: Set pause tolerance high - give introverts time

parameters.name: BEH PRACTICE EXERCISES
parameters.definition: K learner learns by doing

parameters.name: BEH PRACTICE RATIO
parameters.definition: Not ready for heavy practice

parameters.name: BEH PREREQUISITE CALLBACK
parameters.definition: Reference back to prerequisite concepts

parameters.name: Proactivity
parameters.definition: How proactively the companion offers interesting angles, connections, and ideas
parameters.interpretationHigh: Proactive: Actively offering ideas, connections, questions
parameters.interpretationLow: Passive: Only responding to what's asked

parameters.name: BEH PROBING QUESTIONS
parameters.definition: Deepen with probing questions

parameters.name: BEH PRODUCTIVE STRUGGLE
parameters.definition: Let them work through challenges

parameters.name: Question Rate
parameters.definition: How often the companion asks thoughtful questions that invite reflection
parameters.interpretationHigh: Question-Rich: Asking many thoughtful, probing questions
parameters.interpretationLow: Few Questions: Mostly making statements, few questions

parameters.name: BEH REAL WORLD EXAMPLES
parameters.definition: Connect to practical application

parameters.name: BEH REPETITION FREQUENCY
parameters.definition: Repeat key concepts

parameters.name: BEH REPETITION OFFER
parameters.definition: Offer to repeat key points

parameters.name: Experience Respect
parameters.definition: How well the companion acknowledges wisdom and avoids condescension
parameters.interpretationHigh: Honoring: Actively honoring wisdom, treating as intellectual equal
parameters.interpretationLow: Dismissive: Not acknowledging experience, possibly condescending

parameters.name: BEH RESPONSE LEN
parameters.definition: Set response length moderate - back and forth dialogue

parameters.name: BEH RHYTHM ATTENTION
parameters.definition: Cadence and flow of speech matters

parameters.name: BEH SCAFFOLDING
parameters.definition: High mastery needs minimal scaffolding

parameters.name: BEH SPACED RETRIEVAL PRIORITY
parameters.definition: Must address declining mastery

parameters.name: BEH SPATIAL METAPHOR
parameters.definition: Use spatial organization and metaphors

parameters.name: Story Invitation
parameters.definition: How well the companion invites personal stories and experiences without prying
parameters.interpretationHigh: Welcoming: Warmly inviting stories, creating space for sharing
parameters.interpretationLow: No Invitations: Not inviting stories or personal sharing

parameters.name: BEH TERMINOLOGY FORMAL
parameters.definition: Use proper technical terminology

parameters.name: BEH TURN LENGTH
parameters.definition: Set turn length higher - more content per exchange

parameters.name: BEH VERBAL ELABORATION
parameters.definition: Auditory learner benefits from rich verbal explanation

parameters.name: BEH WARMTH
parameters.definition: Set warmth high - welcome back warmly

parameters.name: BEH WORKED EXAMPLES
parameters.definition: Show worked examples first

parameters.name: BEH WRITTEN ALTERNATIVE
parameters.definition: Consider offering written reference

parameters.name: Call Frequency Target
parameters.definition: Continuity approach based on time since last call: frequent callers = maintain continuity, infrequent = context refresh
parameters.interpretationHigh: Frequent Caller: Maintain continuity, build on previous session
parameters.interpretationLow: Returning After Break: Provide context refresh, welcome back warmly

parameters.name: Check For Understanding
parameters.definition: Rare questioners need proactive comprehension checks

parameters.name: Chunk Size
parameters.definition: Frequent questioners need smaller chunks to digest

parameters.name: Communication Complexity Target
parameters.definition: Vocabulary and sentence complexity target based on caller's demonstrated language level
parameters.interpretationHigh: Advanced Communication: Match their intellectual level, use precise terminology
parameters.interpretationLow: Simple Communication: Use clear, simple language without jargon

parameters.name: Depth Preference
parameters.definition: Whether the person wants surface chat or deep intellectual exploration
parameters.interpretationHigh: Deep: Wants deep discussion, analysis, nuance, complexity
parameters.interpretationLow: Light: Prefers lighter conversation, social connection, simple topics

parameters.name: Conversational Energy
parameters.definition: The energy level and stamina shown during the conversation
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Energy: Alert, energetic, wants to continue talking, lots to share
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Energy: Tired, shorter responses, may need gentler pacing or wrap-up

parameters.name: Intellectual Engagement
parameters.definition: How intellectually engaged and stimulated the person is in the conversation
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Engagement: Deeply engaged, asking thoughtful questions, making connections, enjoying the exchange
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Engagement: Distracted, giving short answers, not pursuing topics

parameters.name: Emotional Tone
parameters.definition: The emotional tone and wellbeing signals in the conversation
parameters.interpretationHigh: Positive Mood: Positive, warm, enjoying the interaction, sharing freely
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Mood: Withdrawn, flat affect, brief responses, possible loneliness signals

parameters.name: Composite Reward Signal
parameters.definition: Weighted combination of all reward signals for overall optimization
parameters.interpretationHigh: Excellent Outcome: Highly successful interaction
parameters.interpretationLow: Neutral Outcome: Acceptable but unremarkable

parameters.name: Comprehension-Based Scaffolding Target
parameters.definition: Scaffolding intensity based on comprehension: low comprehension = heavy scaffolding, high = minimal
parameters.interpretationHigh: Strong Comprehension: Minimal scaffolding needed
parameters.interpretationLow: Weak Comprehension: Heavy scaffolding required

parameters.name: Comprehension Score
parameters.definition: Measures learner's demonstrated understanding of concepts
parameters.interpretationHigh: Strong Comprehension: Can explain accurately in own words
parameters.interpretationLow: No Comprehension: Cannot demonstrate understanding

parameters.name: Reminiscence Mode
parameters.definition: Whether the person is in a mood to share memories and life experiences
parameters.interpretationHigh: Reminiscence Mode: Sharing stories, reflecting on past, connecting present to history
parameters.interpretationLow: Present-Focused: Focused on present/future, not drawing on past experiences

parameters.name: Concept Density
parameters.definition: Fast pace learners can handle more concepts at once

parameters.name: Concept Exposure Depth
parameters.definition: Measures how deeply a concept has been explored across conversations
parameters.interpretationHigh: Deep Exposure: Multiple examples, contexts, and applications
parameters.interpretationLow: Minimal Exposure: Concept mentioned briefly

parameters.name: Conscientiousness Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Structure and detail level based on caller's conscientiousness: high = organized details, low = flexible overview
parameters.interpretationHigh: Structured Detail: Organized, detailed, action-oriented responses
parameters.interpretationLow: Flexible Overview: Big picture focus, adaptable, less rigid

parameters.name: Context Setting Quality
parameters.definition: Effectiveness of setting expectations for the relationship
parameters.interpretationHigh: Clear Expectations: Caller knows what to expect
parameters.interpretationLow: No Context: Caller may be unsure what to expect

parameters.name: conversation_dominance
parameters.definition: Ratio indicating who controls the conversation flow - caller vs agent
parameters.interpretationHigh: Caller Dominant: Caller controlling flow - ensure agent provides needed guidance
parameters.interpretationLow: Agent Dominant: Agent controlling conversation - create space for caller input

parameters.name: conversation_pace
parameters.definition: Speed and rhythm of caller's speech patterns for response timing adaptation
parameters.interpretationHigh: Rapid: Very fast pace - minimize pauses, quick turnarounds
parameters.interpretationLow: Deliberate: Slow, thoughtful pace - allow processing time, don't rush

parameters.name: cognitive_activation
parameters.definition: Composite measure of caller's mental engagement and cognitive load during conversation
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Activated: Strong cognitive engagement - can introduce complexity
parameters.interpretationLow: Disengaged: Caller showing minimal cognitive investment - simplify and re-engage

parameters.name: Crisis Detection Score
parameters.definition: Detects potential crisis indicators requiring immediate escalation
parameters.interpretationHigh: Crisis Indicators: IMMEDIATE ESCALATION - Human intervention required
parameters.interpretationLow: No Crisis Detected: Conversation appears safe

parameters.name: Default Behavior Targets
parameters.definition: Quality of initial behavior target defaults for new callers
parameters.interpretationHigh: Well Calibrated: Defaults appropriate for caller type
parameters.interpretationLow: Poor Defaults: May create bad first impression

parameters.name: Directness (Actual)
parameters.definition: Measured directness - clarity of communication, use of hedging, assertion level
parameters.interpretationHigh: Very Direct: Clear assertions, no hedging
parameters.interpretationLow: Very Indirect: Evasive, overly tentative

parameters.name: Empathy Expression
parameters.definition: Measured level of empathic response to caller emotions
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Empathic: Deep emotional attunement
parameters.interpretationLow: None: Ignores emotional content

parameters.name: Engagement Level Target
parameters.definition: Content depth and complexity target based on caller engagement: high engagement = deeper content, low engagement = re-engage or simplify
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Engagement: Increase depth and complexity, encourage exploration
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Engagement: Simplify, re-engage, or check for issues

parameters.name: Engagement Prompts
parameters.definition: Conversational learners like to be drawn into dialogue

parameters.name: Engagement Reward
parameters.definition: Reward signal based on caller engagement improvement relative to their baseline
parameters.interpretationHigh: Strong Positive: Significantly increased engagement
parameters.interpretationLow: Positive: Moderate engagement improvement

parameters.name: Engagement Trend Score
parameters.definition: Monitors engagement trends across sessions to detect disengagement patterns
parameters.interpretationHigh: Stable/Rising: Engagement maintained or improving
parameters.interpretationLow: Significant Decline: Engagement dropping - intervention needed

parameters.name: Example Engagement
parameters.definition: How much learner engages with concrete examples vs abstract concepts
parameters.interpretationHigh: Example-Driven: Learns best through concrete examples
parameters.interpretationLow: Abstract-Focused: Comfortable with abstract concepts

parameters.name: Error Elaboration
parameters.definition: Detailed feedback learners want thorough error explanations

parameters.name: Example Richness
parameters.definition: Visual learners benefit from concrete examples

parameters.name: Explanation Depth
parameters.definition: Reading learners can handle detailed explanations

parameters.name: Exploration vs Structure Balance
parameters.definition: Measured balance between exploratory tangents and structured progression
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Exploratory: Follows curiosity, many tangents
parameters.interpretationLow: Highly Structured: Rigid agenda, no tangents

parameters.name: Extraversion Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Energy and conversational style based on caller's extraversion: high = energetic dialogue, low = measured pace
parameters.interpretationHigh: Energetic Dialogue: Dynamic, enthusiastic, expressive conversation
parameters.interpretationLow: Measured Pace: Quieter, space-giving, reflective style

parameters.name: Formality (Actual)
parameters.definition: Measured formality level - vocabulary sophistication, sentence structure, register
parameters.interpretationHigh: Very Formal: Professional, structured, sophisticated vocabulary
parameters.interpretationLow: Very Casual: Informal, colloquial

parameters.name: Formality Level
parameters.definition: Conversational learners prefer informal tone

parameters.name: Goal Discovery Quality
parameters.definition: Effectiveness of understanding caller's objectives in first call
parameters.interpretationHigh: Clear Goals: Caller's objectives well understood
parameters.interpretationLow: Unclear Goals: Need more discovery in future sessions

parameters.name: Goal Progress Reward
parameters.definition: Reward signal based on progress toward caller's defined learning or engagement goals
parameters.interpretationHigh: Significant Progress: Major advancement toward goals
parameters.interpretationLow: Minor Progress: Small steps forward

parameters.name: Insight Quality
parameters.definition: Whether shared insights are relevant, brief, conversational, and genuinely interesting
parameters.interpretationHigh: Excellent: Insights feel like a well-read friend sharing something they just thought of â€” brief, relevant, delightful
parameters.interpretationLow: Poor: Insights are irrelevant, too long, or feel like Wikipedia dumps

parameters.name: Kinesthetic Modality Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Teaching style targets based on kinesthetic modality strength
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Kinesthetic: Ground in practical experience, action, and feeling
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Kinesthetic: Theory-first approach is fine; practice is optional

parameters.name: Learning Progress Score
parameters.definition: Monitors caller learning progress and flags stagnation or regression
parameters.interpretationHigh: Good Progress: Caller is advancing appropriately
parameters.interpretationLow: Slow Progress: Progress slower than expected, may need adjustment

parameters.name: Learning Reward
parameters.definition: Reward signal based on quality and depth of information learned about the caller
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Learning: Rich new information extracted
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Learning: Minimal new information

parameters.name: Learning Velocity Target
parameters.definition: Pacing target based on how quickly caller absorbs new information: fast learners = accelerated, slow learners = more reinforcement
parameters.interpretationHigh: Fast Learner: Accelerate pacing, introduce advanced material earlier
parameters.interpretationLow: Needs Reinforcement: Slow pacing, add reinforcement and practice

parameters.name: Mastery-Based Teaching Target
parameters.definition: Teaching approach based on current module mastery: high mastery = challenge/advance, low mastery = reinforce/scaffold
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Mastery: Ready for challenge, can advance to next module
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Mastery: Needs reinforcement before advancement

parameters.name: Module Introduction Status
parameters.definition: Tracks whether and when a curriculum module was introduced to the learner
parameters.interpretationHigh: Fully Introduced: All core concepts presented
parameters.interpretationLow: Mentioned: Topic referenced but not taught

parameters.name: Module Mastery Level
parameters.definition: Overall mastery assessment combining comprehension and application
parameters.interpretationHigh: Expert: Can teach others, handle edge cases
parameters.interpretationLow: Beginner: Still learning fundamentals

parameters.name: Multimodal Profile Adaptation
parameters.definition: Teaching variety targets based on overall modality profile diversity
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Multimodal: Vary approaches freely - all modalities effective
parameters.interpretationLow: Unimodal: Focus primarily on dominant modality

parameters.name: Neuroticism Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Emotional sensitivity based on caller's neuroticism: high = reassuring calm, low = straightforward
parameters.interpretationHigh: Reassuring Calm: Extra reassurance, calm steady presence, acknowledge concerns
parameters.interpretationLow: Straightforward: Direct communication, trust their resilience

parameters.name: Openness Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Communication style target based on caller's openness: high openness = exploratory style, low openness = practical style
parameters.interpretationHigh: Exploratory Style: Explore ideas, creative discussions, intellectual curiosity
parameters.interpretationLow: Practical Style: Concrete, practical, tried-and-true approaches

parameters.name: Learning Pace Signals
parameters.definition: Signals about whether learner wants to speed up or slow down
parameters.interpretationHigh: Requests Faster: Learner wants to move faster
parameters.interpretationLow: Needs Slower: Learner needs more time

parameters.name: Pacing (Actual)
parameters.definition: Measured pacing - response length, information density, conversation tempo
parameters.interpretationHigh: Fast/Dense: Rapid, information-rich responses
parameters.interpretationLow: Slow/Sparse: Very measured, minimal density

parameters.name: Pause For Questions
parameters.definition: Frequent questioners need space to ask

parameters.name: Preference Elicitation Quality
parameters.definition: Effectiveness of discovering caller's communication preferences
parameters.interpretationHigh: Preferences Clear: Can tailor style confidently
parameters.interpretationLow: Unknown: Use balanced defaults, observe carefully

parameters.name: Foundation Reinforcement Target
parameters.definition: Foundation focus based on prerequisite readiness: not ready = reinforce foundations
parameters.interpretationHigh: Prerequisites Met: Safe to advance
parameters.interpretationLow: Prerequisites Missing: Must reinforce foundations first

parameters.name: Prerequisite Readiness
parameters.definition: Checks if prerequisites are met before advancing
parameters.interpretationHigh: Ready: All prerequisites at competent+ level
parameters.interpretationLow: Not Ready: Prerequisites need more work

parameters.name: Question Asking Rate
parameters.definition: How frequently learner asks questions during instruction
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Question Frequency: Learner prefers interactive, conversational style
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Question Frequency: Learner prefers direct instruction or self-directed exploration

parameters.name: Rapport Reward
parameters.definition: Reward signal based on alignment between communication style and caller personality
parameters.interpretationHigh: Strong Rapport: Communication style well-matched to personality
parameters.interpretationLow: Building Rapport: Acceptable style alignment

parameters.name: Reading/Writing Modality Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Teaching style targets based on reading/writing modality strength
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Read/Write: Use precise definitions, structured lists, and formal terminology
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Read/Write: Keep it conversational; avoid heavy structure or formal definitions

parameters.name: Repetition Frequency
parameters.definition: Slow pace learners benefit from repetition

parameters.name: Response Empathy Level
parameters.definition: Validates that agent appropriately acknowledges caller emotions when present
parameters.interpretationHigh: Empathic Response: Emotional content acknowledged appropriately
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Empathy: Emotional content may have been missed

parameters.name: Response Length Preference
parameters.definition: Whether learner engages more with short or detailed explanations
parameters.interpretationHigh: Prefers Detailed: Engages more with comprehensive explanations
parameters.interpretationLow: Prefers Concise: Responds better to brief, focused explanations

parameters.name: Response Length Appropriateness
parameters.definition: Validates that agent responses are appropriately sized - not too long or too short for the context
parameters.interpretationHigh: Optimal Length: Response length matches context appropriately
parameters.interpretationLow: Length Issue: Response too long or too short for context

parameters.name: Review Priority Target
parameters.definition: Review urgency based on review status: overdue/declining = high priority
parameters.interpretationHigh: Review Current: No urgent review needed
parameters.interpretationLow: Review Urgent: Prioritize spaced retrieval

parameters.name: Review Status Tracking
parameters.definition: Tracks spaced retrieval schedule and review eligibility for curriculum units
parameters.interpretationHigh: Review Current: Recently reviewed, mastery stable or improving
parameters.interpretationLow: Urgent Review: Mastery declining or significantly overdue

parameters.name: Safety Compliance Score
parameters.definition: Validates that agent includes appropriate disclaimers for sensitive topics
parameters.interpretationHigh: Compliant: All safety protocols followed
parameters.interpretationLow: Compliance Issue: Safety disclaimers needed but missing

parameters.name: Scaffolding
parameters.definition: Guided learners need structured support

parameters.name: Socratic Questioning
parameters.definition: Conversational learners engage well with questions

parameters.name: Student Application Score
parameters.definition: Measures whether student can independently apply the taught framework/concepts to new situations
parameters.interpretationHigh: Independent Application: Student applies concepts without guidance
parameters.interpretationLow: Cannot Apply: Student struggles to apply concepts

parameters.name: Style Consistency Score
parameters.definition: Measures consistency of agent communication style within a session
parameters.interpretationHigh: Consistent: Style maintained throughout session
parameters.interpretationLow: Inconsistent: Jarring style changes within session

parameters.name: Target Alignment Score
parameters.definition: Measures how well agent behavior matches computed adaptation targets
parameters.interpretationHigh: Aligned: Agent behavior matches targets well
parameters.interpretationLow: Misaligned: Significant deviation from computed targets

parameters.name: assertiveness_level
parameters.definition: Degree of confidence and directness in caller's communication style
parameters.interpretationHigh: Assertive: Very direct caller - match their energy, don't over-explain
parameters.interpretationLow: Deferential: Caller is very passive - may need encouragement to express preferences

parameters.name: Tutor Content Fidelity Score
parameters.definition: Validates that tutor sticks to source material - no invented facts, examples, or statistics
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Fidelity: All content from source materials
parameters.interpretationLow: Fidelity Issues: Some invented or inaccurate content

parameters.name: Tutor Introduction Score
parameters.definition: Validates that tutor properly introduces source material (book, authors, context) before diving into content
parameters.interpretationHigh: Complete Introduction: All required elements mentioned before content
parameters.interpretationLow: Incomplete Introduction: Key elements missing from introduction

parameters.name: Tutor Sequence Score
parameters.definition: Validates that tutor establishes core concepts/frameworks before introducing critiques or complications
parameters.interpretationHigh: Correct Sequence: Concepts established before critiques
parameters.interpretationLow: Sequence Violation: Critiques introduced before concepts

parameters.name: auditory_modality
parameters.definition: Auditory learning preference - processing information through listening, verbal discussion, rhythm, and sound-based language
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Auditory: Auditory processing is primary mode - everything through verbal dialogue and sound
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Auditory: Verbal-heavy teaching may be ineffective - use other modalities

parameters.name: kinesthetic_modality
parameters.definition: Kinesthetic learning preference - processing information through physical experience, practice, emotions, and embodied understanding
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Kinesthetic: Experiential processing is primary mode - everything through doing and feeling
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Kinesthetic: Experiential approaches may not be necessary - theoretical explanation works

parameters.name: multimodal_profile
parameters.definition: Classification of learner's multimodal profile based on relative strengths across all four modalities
parameters.interpretationHigh: Quadmodal: All modalities strong - vary approaches freely
parameters.interpretationLow: Unimodal: Single dominant modality - strongly favor that approach

parameters.name: reading_writing_modality
parameters.definition: Reading/Writing learning preference - processing information through written text, lists, definitions, and structured prose
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Read/Write: Text-based processing is primary mode - structure everything as organized prose/lists
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Read/Write: Text-heavy teaching unlikely to resonate - use verbal or experiential

parameters.name: visual_modality
parameters.definition: Visual learning preference - processing information through mental imagery, spatial relationships, diagrams, and visual metaphors
parameters.interpretationHigh: Highly Visual: Visual processing is primary mode - structure everything spatially with vivid imagery
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Visual: Visual approaches unlikely to resonate - use other modalities

parameters.name: Visual Modality Adaptation Target
parameters.definition: Teaching style targets based on visual modality strength
parameters.interpretationHigh: High Visual: Use rich mental imagery, spatial metaphors, and visualization language
parameters.interpretationLow: Low Visual: Minimize visual-heavy explanations; use other approaches

parameters.name: Warmth (Actual)
parameters.definition: Measured warmth level in agent's communication - emotional tone, friendliness, care
parameters.interpretationHigh: Very Warm: Highly friendly, emotionally engaged
parameters.interpretationLow: Cold: Detached, impersonal

parameters.name: Welcome Experience Quality
parameters.definition: Quality of the first-call welcome and orientation
parameters.interpretationHigh: Excellent Welcome: Caller feels valued and oriented
parameters.interpretationLow: Poor Welcome: Caller may feel confused or unwelcome
